wikipedia_page.main: Major-General Charles Theophilus Evelyn Metcalfe, CB (7 February 1856 – 1912) was a British Army officer who became General Officer Commanding 6th Division.

response: *Charles Metcalfe, 1st Baron Metcalfe (1785–1846), British colonial administrator

His background and place of birth is unclear. He is termed "Major" in most references and is presumed to have been in the Royal Engineers (due to his mining interests) or possibly (due to his connections to Sir Charles Metcalfe) in the Rifle Brigade.
*In 1889 he wrote articles regarding propaganda in Rhodesia in the "Fortnightly Review" with Sir Charles Metcalfe.Rhodes and Rhodesia: The White Conquest of Zimbabwe 1884-1902, Arthur Keppel-Jones
*British Sphere of Influence in South Africa (1889) again with Sir Charles Metcalfe
